name: Hotel & Bungalows Mayaland

reviews.title: Glad We Stayed at Mayaland
reviews.text: We booked an overnight tour to Chichen Itza and stayed at the Mayaland Hotel. The main point was to be able to see the light show at night and to visit the ruins in the morning before the heat and the tourists. That worked extremely well, although the light show was all in Spanish and we were never told how to get the headsets for the translation. Still, it was worth seeing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Since our Mayaland reservation was part of our tour, we had no idea of what kind of room we would get. It turned out that our "junior suite" was two double rooms. They were next door to each other, but not adjoining. However, four double beds for three people was more than generous. One room was large with a sitting area, the other was smaller, but with an extra-large bathroom and a balcony. Both rooms had old clunker air conditioners. Do not look for any high tech amenities; there are not even phones in the rooms.
reviews.title: staff clueless, room overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: We loved the property. I couldn't get enough the tropical lushness, and the beautiful buildings. Part of the Chichen Itza ruins are right on the hotel grounds and you can look at so much more than the tourists get to see on the afternoon guided tour.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was less of a delight unfortunately. The tour buffet was not that great. The special Yucatan tacos were not nice at all. The main restaurant was beautiful, and we enjoyed dining on the terrace, but the fixed price meal cost quite a bit more than the menu said it would.
reviews.title: Good location but very disappointing room
Great location, nice hotel
reviews.text: On the bus tour we learned that the people who live in that part of the Yucatan are Mayan, and Spanish is their second language. Most of them don't learn Spanish until they go to school. That makes English their third language, and yes it shows. If you think of this as a cultural excursion and don't expect too much, you will probably have a wonderful time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently I returned from a returned from the best vacation I have ever had! I have stayed at Mayaland before and had a wonderful experience then. I decided to return and the staff changed my stay from good to great! Everything was perfect! A special note has to be made about the wait staff at the hotel restaurant. They were so polite and courteous that it made eating a complete joy. The last trip I had made to Mayaland had been about 10 years ago. Back then, I had made friends with some of the wait staff. To my surprise, they remembered me! From that point on, my vacation was a dream. I would recommend Mayaland to anyone traveling to the Yucatan Peninsula. I would rate this hotel and services 5 BIG STARS for excellence!
reviews.title: The best vacation I have ever had!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We returned to the same hotel where we were married 15 years earlier. I have to say it is still wonderful! The service and the friendly staff were incredible. we specially loved our morning breakfast in the outdoor patio with the birds singing all around us. It was a surprisingly good deal considering the breakfast buffet, welcome drink, and welcome typical Mexican platter was included in the price of the hotel. We stayed in the bungalows and i have to say it was one of the most relaxing places i have been just lying on the hammock talking with friends and listening to the birds. definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Great Stay but not long enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, i must note Chichen Itza, is not worth going to if you have already been. You can not climb any of the ruins and there are hundreds of vendors EVERYWHERE you turn. really depressing to see it like that. Just stay at the hotel or go visit nearby Ek Balam if you want see nice ruins that i think are better than Chichen Itza
reviews.title: Wow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here as part of a tour of the Yucatan. The ambience is fantastic. It's proximity to the historic site of Chichen Itza means you can walk from the hotel into the Chichen Itza site easily. We had an escorted tour in the morning and lunch back at the hotel, our tickets were valid for the day so we were able to go back in again for the afternoon. It was January so the whole place was quiet.
reviews.title: Should have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable, the room had everything we needed and was a charming wooden building with a balcony and a pool right outside.
reviews.title: The perfekt place to visit Chichén Itzá

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mayaland for 1 night prior to our visit to Chichen Itza. We chose the hotel based on location and it definitely delivered in that regard. As others have mentioned, it is literally next to the ruins, which allowed us to easily visit first thing in the morning before the crowds and vendors arrived. I would absolutely recommend an overnight stay to anyone visiting Chichen Itza who can manage it.
reviews.title: Location location location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel itself was pretty good. The grounds are lovely and a nice place for a stroll after our drive from the Ruta Puuc area. We loved the beautiful trees and the peacock on the property was esspecially nice to see. It even displayed its tail feathers for us. The bar has some nice outside seating, which afforded a nice view of the property.
reviews.title: Mayaland/Grayline Tour
Top notch hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed in the main building, which has some great colonial architecture. Our room was good. We had a nice balcony with a view of the Chichen Itza observatory right from our room. Wow. The bed was reasonably comfortable and everything in our room worked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: There are a few negatives with this hotel. Were it not for the fabulous location, I would only give this hotel a rating of 3 rather than 4.
reviews.title: Worth way more than the price you pay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The biggest negative was the food. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel - breakfast was pretty good, but dinner left a lot ot be desired. We went in with low expectations since we know this hotel caters to a lot of large tour groups - we expected the food to be pricey and not esspecially good, but even with low expectations we were disappointed. We went to the dinner buffet because the menu at the al a carte restaurant was pricey and not particularly Yucatecan. The food at the buffet was edible - and that is all. The selection contained nothing even remotely Yucatecan, and the food was entirely bland. I understand the challenges of feeding large groups of people, but things like rice, beans, tortillas, and cochinita pibil lend themselves very well for feeding large groups. The hotel should provide at least some local food in the buffet. They did have flan on the dessert table, but it was not good at all.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel close to the ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Mexico and we stayed at the Mayaland resort Friday Jan 5, 2007. We rented a car in Cancun and drove on the toll road to get there. We had to drive in the dark which was a bit of an adventure. The road was really nice and there was minimal traffic. We were surprised at the cost for the toll though (185 pesos). Be sure to have some pesos before you hit the road. After we drove through Piste it was a short drive to the hotel, but it was a bit cofusing in the dark. We made it though.
reviews.title: Great place to visit away from the big city

likes.liked: — The proximity to the ruins, and the grounds
likes.disliked: — go to the ruins early to beat the heat and the tour buses!

reviews.title: Not what we expected
reviews.text: We absolutely loved the Mayaland hotel. The grounds are gorgeous and I haven't seen that many stars in a long time. I will say that it is a bit rustic, and the price wasn't cheap. We felt that it was worth it to be so close to the ruins. We stayed in a bungalow very close to the entrance to the ruins. As previous reviews stated, the air conditioner was old and the TV wasn't amazing but that isn't why we went to Mexico. We opened all of the windows in our bungalow since they were screened and we listened to the wonderful sounds of the Jungle all night. The bathroom was nice and the room was clean. We did not eat dinner at the restaurant, we did have a snack at the bar and we had breakfast. They were both good, but not fancy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The morning after we arrived we arranged to have a guide take us into the ruins. He worked for the hotel and he was great. He had nearly 30 years of experience and his level of knowledge was extensive. We went into the ruins at 8am and we spent about 3 hours and I felt that we got to see everything.
reviews.title: Great room

likes.liked: — The grounds and the location, all the historical sites in easy walking distance

reviews.title: Excellent, old world charm at Mayaland
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel, but it depends on what you are looking for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: The location and the hotel grounds can't be beat. We woke early and entered the ruins at 8:00 in the morning and pretty much had the place to ourselves. The hotel itself leaves much to be desired. The rooms were neat and clean but the TV and air conditioning unit were at least 15 years old. They had several restaurants on the premises but only one was opened each evening. Choice was somewhat limited - food was okay but nothing special. They had an extensive wine list but only the most expensive ones were available. There was no pool service. As a guest, we felt that the hotel was more interested in the tours that passed though than us. You are fairly isolated and had no choice but to eat and drink there unless you had a car. For the price we paid we exepcted much more service and more updated facilities
reviews.title: Disapppointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Mayaland Hotel, in mid-February. The Hotel has been there since 1926 and has the charm of hotels of that era. It has been extremely well maintained and renewed. I would describe it as understated elegance. A special treat was the excellent restaurant and Rogelio and the kitchen and wait staff. We enjoyed every meal. One evening I had chicken breast stuffed with squash blossoms. It was superb. The next evening Rogelio surprised us with dessert of crepes suzette. It was excellent.
reviews.title: What a wonderful surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mayaland Hotel is at the back entrance to Chichen Itza. This entrance is about 100 meters from the hotel door. We entered the Park when it opened at 8:00 am and had the place nearly to ourselves for several hours. About 10:00 am the tour buses from Cancun start to arrive. By then we were deep into the park and by noon we were ready for lunch at the hotel. But, we had four quiet hours in the park to explore the ruins.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: That evening we enjoyed the Mayan Skies presentation at the Mayaland Hotel Planetarium followed by an opportunity to observe Jupiter through a telescope with the assitance of a trained astronomer.
reviews.title: Superb! Lovely place, great staff, luxurious rooms with bath and a private entrance to Chichan Itza !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will be visiting again soon.
reviews.title: Great place to stay while visiting the ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was very good. Room clean, nice private balcony to relax on (we had a superior room). Coffee maker in room if you like black coffee. Mini bar. No safe in room. 2 double beds a bit small, pillows hard. Very large bath/ jacuzzi. Free wi-fi in lobby.
reviews.title: Lovely place close to the site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel think they are five stars.. well they are not they are three. But it really is a perfect location to see Chichen Itza, no doubt. If you are expecting a three stars hotel and a good location this is the place for you...
reviews.title: Three stars but still not really good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the small village of Piste, the closest town to the Chichen Itza ruins, my boyfriend and I stumbled upon Mayaland - a resort that looks like it should be extraordinarily expensive, but is actually quite reasonable and VERY worth the $100 - a night price! We were treated like a king and queen by the very helpful and professional bilingual staff. Our room was lovely - bathroom beautiful. The Bungalows run more expensive, over $200, but I'm sure it would be worth it for a family or a couple with the extra cash. I would HIGHLy recommend this resort if you wish to stay by the ruins and feel pampered.
reviews.title: Mayaland: Beautiful resort at the foot of Chichen Itza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only disappointment was the lack of Mexican cuisine in the resort's restaurant. We drove into town and ate at Chichen Itza Restaurant in Piste and were very pleased.
reviews.title: We loved this Hotel

likes.liked: — Grounds were beautiful, and the staff was very friendly
likes.disliked: — As everywhere else in Mexico - the beds were HARD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited this resort, and fell in love with it. We stayed in the Kabah bungalow, it wasn't FANCY, but It was clean and it was a unique experience. Especially like the walk in shower. The grounds were beautiful, and the breakfast served outside was also good. Would love to go again.
reviews.title: The worst experience I had in Mexico

likes.disliked: — no hay nada que me gustara.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a one-night stay in Mayaland so we are on way to Maya Riviera and wanted to see Chichen Itzá. The advertisement in Internet was great so we decided to book, regardless the high price, but we thought it worth due to the "wrong idea" we obtain from the web. The place was awful. There is a swimming pool where people who goes to see Chichen Itzá, stop to have lunch there and take advantage of the swimming pool. These people are with dust, etc.. so they come from the ruins and you can see clearly how dirty the swimming pool is. In the hotel they were doing some work, and could´nt sleep. The room was really awful and the only thing we wanted was to pass the night in order to go. We did not wait till breakfast, once the sun appear, went to the reception, check out, take the car, and follow our way. I will never go back to that place again.
reviews.title: Best way to see Chichen Itzá

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Mayaland had a charm that most hotels do not have. The hotel is located in the heart of the jungle, so do expect some beetles and other small creatures, although the staff does keep the grounds and rooms as free of these surprises as possible. (Although our first night we did sleep with a gecko on our wall, but he seemed as tired as we were.)
reviews.title: We loved the Mayaland!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was wonderful with a balcony that was accessed through french doors. very clean, and a large bathroom. The floors are beautifully tiled, I imagine carpeting would mold because of the humidity. Each morning we awoke to the sound of hundreds of birds, and beautiful peacocks roaming the grounds.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for visiting Chichen Itza

likes.liked: — Location to the ruins and the beautiful grounds
likes.disliked: — Bad air conditioner - no phone or safe in room - not a deal breaker for us - but could be a problem for others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: An amazing view of some of the ruins greets you from the lobby and other areas of the hotel. Through a private entrance you can gain access to Chichen Itza and come and go as you please. Do take lots of bottled water as you tour the ruins, it gets HOT! Also watch for iguanas as you wander, they are everywhere.
reviews.title: Beautiful Gardens and Ghastly Hotel

likes.liked: — The grounds and view of t he ruins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The swimming pool was great, and you must take a 5 minute cab ride to the "Ik Kil" Cenote. It was a highlight of our trip. Cenotes are sinkholes formed in the limestone and they create huge cavernous pools with fresh water. Tree roots grow down from the top of the sink hole and fish swim in the water. It is a fabulous experience, one not to be missed.
reviews.title: Mayaland Bungalows - Great location to Chichen Itza

likes.liked: — The very close location to Chichen Itza
likes.disliked: — The far location from everything else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have to say the food wasn't great, but it did keep us from starving, the atmosphere made up for the food.
reviews.title: Best resort ever!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were very surprised at the elegant grounds and atmosphere of this hotel given we had paid only $69 for a room! The room was in the main building right above one of the bars and restaurants so it was a bit noisy until 11pm but very convenient. Surprisingly their were no windows but french doors opened out to a terrace with chairs and table. Louvers in the doors at both ends provided lots of ventilation. The bathroom was very elegant with a big tub and shower and marble like tiles.
reviews.title: Great value and beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel makes its' money on the restaurant. Basically it's buffet style. There is a la carte but so expensive you might as well get the buffet. The main pool is very large and attractive and there are two other smaller pools surrounded by the bungalows, a more expensive option. We saw a peacock roaming the garden and the flowers and trees throughout are labeled.
reviews.title: Better than expected and right next to the ruins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: There is a private entrance to Chichen Itza and a large gift shop. There's a lovely view of the Observatory from the bar and some of the rooms. My only criticism is that there wasn't any hot water at 10am when we showered.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: My wife and I were interested in seeing Chichén Itzá and booked two nights at the Mayaland to do so. We knew it was right next to the ruins and looked nice enough. It was also not terribly expensive, so we figured it would be pretty basic.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were wrong. It was very nice - our room had a great deck and a jacuzzi tub. We ate at the restaurant for all our meals and were pleasantly surprised with how good it was. It wasn't gourmet, but it was darn tasty.
reviews.title: Georgous Place!!

description: World-Class resort in a unique Tropical setting inside the Chichen Itza Arqueological Park. One of the 100 hotels on National Geographic "The Stay List" 2009 and again in one of the "133 Hotels we love, December 2011. Conde Nast Reader's One of the 100 Top Hotels in the World 2003. Conde Nast Gold List 2004. The most awarded resort in Yucatan. A member of the Rain Forest Alliance. 100% Mayan staff. Over 100 acres of unique tropical gardens. Award winning restaurants serving Mayan, Yucatecan, Mexican and International delicacies. Spa.
